```{r logit-plot, message=FALSE}

# przygotowania do końcowego wykresu


non_sig_M2 <- c("PGW", "SMP", "NETUALL", "DIGSKILLT", "GDF_C", "EDY_C", "AGE_C", "HTI_C")


lbl <- c(
  IFS = "Finds product \ninfo online",
  LMA = "Manages social \nmedia privacy",
  BSC = "Adjusts browser \ncookie settings",
  FLC = "Creates digital \nfiles",
  SCNTR = "Trust in scientists",
  GENTR = "General trust \nin others"
)


p1 <- plot_model(
  M2,
  show.values = T,
  value.offset = 0.2,
  colors = "Set2",
  rm.terms = non_sig_M2,
  sort.est = T,
  axis.labels = "",
  axis.lim = c(0.6, 5)
) +
  labs(title = "What Helps People Spot False Information Online?",
       subtitle = "People who know how to search for products, manage privacy on social media,\nand adjust browser settings are much more likely to say they can tell if online \ncontent is true. \nTrust in scientists also helps a little, while general trust in others may slightly \nreduce this confidence",
       caption = "Source: own elaboration with CRONOS 3, ESS 10 and 11 survey data") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 1, linetype = "dashed", color = "darkgray", alpha = 0.6) +
  annotate("text", x = 1.5, y = 1.75,
           label = "Odds Ratio of 1 = no effect", color = "darkgray", alpha = 0.6) +
  annotate("text", x = 0.7, y = 1,
           label = "Below 1 = negative effect", color = "#66C2A5" , alpha = 0.6) + 
  annotate("text", x = 5.5, y = 6,
           label = "Above 1 = positive effect", color = "#FC8D62" , alpha = 0.6) + 
  scale_x_discrete(labels = lbl)

plot(p1)


```
